Documentation

Learn how to build your website with boba!

Messages

Messages come in all colors

Default Message

This is the default style if no styling is applied.

Red Message

Add a .red class.

Orange Message

Add an .orange class.

Yellow Message

Add a .yellow class.

Green Message

Add a .green class.

Teal Message

Add a .teal class.

Blue Message

Add a .blue class.

Indigo Message

Add an .indigo class.

Purple Message

Add a .purple class.

Pink Message

Add a .pink class.

<div class="message green">
    <div class="message-header">
        <p>Green Message</p>
    </div>
    <div class="message-body">
        <p>Add a <code>.green</code> class</p>
    </div>
</div>

Body-Only

Messages can be used without a header
(If you're using messages in this way, consider using notifications instead!)

I'm a header-less message!

<div class="message">
    <div class="message-body">
        <p>I'm a header-less message!> class</p>
    </div>
</div>

Styles

Change the look of your messages with ease

Bordered

Add a border around your message using .bordered

Default Message

This is the default style if .bordered is applied.

Red Message

Add both .bordered and .red.

Add a both .bordered and .green classes and remove the message header.

<div class="message bordered">
    <div class="message-header">
        <p>Default Message</p>
    </div>
    <div class="message-body">
        <p>This is the default style if <code>.bordered</code> is applied.</p>
    </div>
</div>

<div class="message bordered red">
    <div class="message-header">
        <p>Red Message</p>
    </div>
    <div class="message-body">
        <p>Add both <code>.bordered</code> and <code>.red</code>.</p>
    </div>
</div>

<div class="message bordered green">
    <div class="message-body">
        <p>Add a both <code>.bordered</code> and <code>.green</code> classes and remove the message header.</p>
    </div>
</div>
